Package chess

Class Queen

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess.Piece
      • chess.Queen
  • public class Queen
extends Piece
    This class models the Queen chess piece, which is an extension of the abstract Piece object.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Queen​(java.lang.String color)
      This is the constructor for the Queen piece.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean isValidMove​(int startRow, int startColumn, int endRow, int endColumn, Tile[][] board)
      This method checks to see if the move made by the queen is in the correct motion.
      Tile[][] updateBoard​(int startRow, int startColumn, int endRow, int endColumn, Tile[][] board)
      This method updates the chessboard based on the move that was input by the Queen.
      boolean validBish​(int startRow, int startColumn, int endRow, int endColumn, Tile[][] board)
      This checks to see if the queen has moved in the motion of a bishop.
      boolean validRook​(int startRow, int startColumn, int endRow, int endColumn, Tile[][] board)
      This checks to see if the queen has moved in the motion of a rook.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Queen

        public Queen​(java.lang.String color)
        This is the constructor for the Queen piece. It accepts either white or black and returns an instance of Queen object.
        Parameters:
        color - accepts either "white" or "black"

    • Method Detail

      • isValidMove

        public boolean isValidMove​(int startRow,
                           int startColumn,
                           int endRow,
                           int endColumn,
                           Tile[][] board)
        This method checks to see if the move made by the queen is in the correct motion.
        Parameters:
        startRow - Row before move
        startColumn - Column before move
        endRow - Row after move
        endColumn - Column after move
        board - board after move
        Returns:
        true if move by Queen is able to be made.

      • validRook

        public boolean validRook​(int startRow,
                         int startColumn,
                         int endRow,
                         int endColumn,
                         Tile[][] board)
        This checks to see if the queen has moved in the motion of a rook.
        Parameters:
        startRow - Row before move
        startColumn - Column before move
        endRow - Row after move
        endColumn - Column after move
        board - board after move
        Returns:
        true if Queen has emulated rook.

      • validBish

        public boolean validBish​(int startRow,
                         int startColumn,
                         int endRow,
                         int endColumn,
                         Tile[][] board)
        This checks to see if the queen has moved in the motion of a bishop.
        Parameters:
        startRow - Row before move
        startColumn - Column before move
        endRow - Row after move
        endColumn - Column after move
        board - board after move
        Returns:

      • updateBoard

        public Tile[][] updateBoard​(int startRow,
                            int startColumn,
                            int endRow,
                            int endColumn,
                            Tile[][] board)
        This method updates the chessboard based on the move that was input by the Queen.
        Parameters:
        startRow - Row before move
        startColumn - Column before move
        endRow - Row after move
        endColumn - Column after move
        board - board after move
        Returns:
        chessboard which is updated with the proposed move.
